ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Auditory Neuropathy Spectrum Disorder (ANSD)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Indicated by absent acoustic reflexes, robust OAEs, and degraded ABR waveforms despite mild-to-moderate SNHL.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sensorineural Hearing Loss (Cochlear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Initial audiogram suggested cochlear loss, but ruled out by the presence of robust OAEs and absent reflexes.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Central Auditory Processing Disorder (CAPD)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient showed deficits on CAPD battery, but these are likely secondary to the neural dyssynchrony of ANSD.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing sensitivity and configuration.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition in quiet.
To evaluate middle ear function and the acoustic reflex arc.
To investigate complaints of poor hearing aid benefit in noise.
To assess outer hair cell function and differentiate cochlear from neural pathology.
To assess neural synchrony and integrity of the auditory pathway.
To quantify auditory processing deficits in difficult listening environments.
To assess the central auditory nervous system.
To screen short-term and working memory.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Initial testing showed bilateral mild-to-moderate sensorineural hearing loss with normal middle ear pressure but absent acoustic reflexes. While word recognition in quiet was good, performance in noise with hearing aids was significantly worse than unaided performance, validating the patient's complaints.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral symmetrical mild-to-moderate SNHL, sloping from 35-40 dB HL in lows to 50-60 dB HL in highs.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRTs 33-35 dB HL; WRS 80-90% at 80 dB HL; no rollover.

tests.name: Tympanometry & Reflexes
tests.result_summary: Normal Type A tympanograms; absent ipsilateral and contralateral acoustic reflexes at 500-4000 Hz.

tests.name: Speech-in-noise (SPIN)
tests.result_summary: In noise (65 dB SPL), HP score dropped from 54% (unaided) to 18% (aided); LP score dropped from 40% (unaided) to 6% (aided), confirming hearing aids were detrimental in noise.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Diagnostic testing confirmed Auditory Neuropathy Spectrum Disorder (ANSD). The combination of robust OAEs (normal outer hair cell function) and absent/degraded ABR waveforms (neural dyssynchrony) is diagnostic. Behavioral testing revealed severe temporal processing deficits.

tests.name: Otoacoustic Emissions (OAEs)
tests.result_summary: TEOAEs and DPOAEs present with abnormally large amplitudes bilaterally.

tests.name: Auditory Brainstem Response (ABR)
tests.result_summary: Significantly degraded morphology; no repeatable Wave I; questionable Waves III/V; no prominent cochlear microphonic.

tests.name: CAPD Battery
tests.result_summary: Poor performance on LPFS, CS, TPDD, RGDT (no gap detection <40ms), and MLD (0 dB release); normal Frequency Pattern.

tests.name: Auditory Late Latency Response (ALLR)
tests.result_summary: ALLR obtained with identifiable cortical responses bilaterally; findings support preserved cortical detection despite ABR abnormalities.

tests.name: Memory screening (TAPS-R)
tests.result_summary: TAPS-R screening completed; no clinically significant short-term/working memory deficit noted.

proposed_items: Referral to otologist and neurologist for comprehensive otoneurological assessment
Use of hearing aids in quiet environments only
Removal of hearing aids in noisy environments
Consideration of cochlear implants if difficulties persist
counseling_actions: Explained ANSD diagnosis as a disorder of neural timing/synchrony rather than just sensitivity
Explained why hearing aids amplify noise/distortion in this condition
Discussed visual communication strategies (e.g., lip reading, cued speech)
Counseled on the option to return hearing aids for credit

escalation.rationale_short: To investigate the etiology of ANSD and rule out other neurological conditions.

follow_up_plan.objective: Return for communication training and ongoing management.

expected_outcome: Diagnosis of bilateral Auditory Neuropathy Spectrum Disorder (ANSD) confirmed.
Patient elected to continue using hearing aids in quiet but remove them in noise.
Patient agreed to complete otoneurological assessment.
Patient agreed to return for communication training.
